inlineContent.text: Contributed 6 session notes in total. Their most active year was 2025.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Discover machine learning & AI frameworks on Apple platforms

abstract.text: Tour the latest updates to machine learning and AI frameworks available on Apple platforms. Whether you are an app developer ready to tap into Apple Intelligence, an ML engineer optimizing models for on-device deployment, or an AI enthusiast exploring the frontier of what is possible, we’ll offer guidance to help select the right tools for your needs.

Liquid Glass unifies Apple platform design language while providing a more dynamic and expressive user experience. Get to know the design principles of Liquid Glass, explore its core optical and physical properties, and learn where to use it and why.
Session notes shared by the community for the community.

Snippets are compact views invoked from App Intents that display information from your app. Now, snippets can allow your app to bring even more capability to Siri, Spotlight, and the Shortcuts app by including buttons and stateful information that offer additional interactivity as part of an intent. In this session, you’ll learn best practices for designing snippets, including guidance on layout, typography, interaction, and intent types.
WWDCNotes is only possible thanks to these awesome volunteers! Contribute now to get listed here as well.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Bring your Live Activity to Apple Watch

abstract.text: Bring Live Activities into the Smart Stack on Apple Watch with iOS 18 and watchOS 11. We’ll cover how Live Activities are presented on Apple Watch, as well as how you can enhance their presentation for the Smart Stack. We’ll also explore additional considerations to ensure Live Activities on Apple Watch always present up-to-date information.

Discover how to bring PaperKit to your iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and visionOS apps. We’ll cover how to seamlessly integrate PencilKit drawing with markup features like shapes and images, and how to customize the user interface. Learn best practices for forward compatibility, and discover advanced customization options to create truly unique markup experiences in your apps.

Learn about the new Contacts authorization modes and how to improve Contacts access in your app. Discover how to integrate the Contact Access Button into your app to share additional contacts on demand and provide an easier path to Contacts authorization. We’ll also cover Contacts security features and an alternative API to be used if the button isn’t appropriate for your app.
